benchmark_details.name: Text-Scene Graph (TSG) Bench
benchmark_details.overview: TSG Bench is a benchmark designed to systematically assess large language models' ability to understand and generate scene graphs from textual narratives, evaluating their interpretation and reasoning capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve large language models' abilities in understanding and generating scene graphs from narratives.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current TSG Bench does not include object attributes or multiple actors in the scene graphs, limiting its complexity.

data.source: Derived from the Ego-centric Action Scene Graphs (EASG) dataset using LLMs and human annotation.
data.format: Custom format for scene graphs and narratives
data.annotation: Generated using a combination of LLM prompts and human validation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance against ground truth answers or scene graphs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics indicate better performance in understanding and generating scene graphs.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance serves as a baseline, showing significant gaps in model outputs for scene generation tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark's tasks were validated through a review process involving human annotators.

harm: Misrepresentation of scene contexts in generated graphs.
Potential biases inherent in scene graph representations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY 4.0 license for datasets used and generated.
